feed.title: Google Cloud: Filestore
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Filestore

entry.content: You can now create regional Filestore instances starting at 100 GiB and scale them in 1 GiB units. The small instances feature is available under Restricted GA in us-central1 and us-east4 regions. For more information, see Small capacity Filestore instances.
entry.summary: You can now create regional Filestore instances starting at 100 GiB and scale them in 1 GiB units.
entry.title: Feature: Filestore small instances

entry.content: The promoteReplica API is available for promoting replicas to regular instances. For more information, see About instance replication.
entry.summary: The promoteReplica API is now available to promote replicas to regular instances. This feature enhances instance management by allowing replicas to be promoted.
entry.title: Feature: New API available for replica promotion

entry.content: You can now use the Filestore CSI driver to create Filestore instances with the NFSv4.1 protocol from the Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) cluster. This feature is available for zonal, regional, and enterprise service tiers.
entry.summary: You can now create Filestore instances using the Filestore CSI driver on GKE. This supports NFSv4.1 protocol and is available across various service tiers, including zonal, regional, and enterprise.
entry.title: Feature: Filestore CSI driver available on GKE
